bioAsHtml: I started programming with Amiga Basic many years ago and didn't stop since then. After a short excursion to Microsoft .Net later on, I concentrated on developing Java applications. While I focused in most projects on backend development, I also worked with different frontend technologies. I have also some experience in developing Android apps and have interest in the Internet of Things. In my spare time I work with Java on a Raspberry Pi, the Leapmotion input device and Lego Mindstorms. During the last months I was busy with a research project about distributed, scalable, evolvable and secure systems, and made some experience with Docker and orchestrating Docker with Kubernetes.

acceptedTalks.title: Managing Docker containers in a cluster - introducing Kubernetes

bio:
I started programming with Amiga Basic many years ago and didn't stop since then. After a short excursion to Microsoft .Net later on, I concentrated on developing Java applications. While I focused in most projects on backend development, I also worked with different frontend technologies.
I have also some experience in developing Android apps and have interest in the Internet of Things. In my spare time I work with Java on a Raspberry Pi, the Leapmotion input device and Lego Mindstorms.
During the last months I was busy with a research project about distributed, scalable, evolvable and secure systems, and made some experience with Docker and orchestrating Docker with Kubernetes.
